import java.util.Scanner;
import java.math.BigInteger;
public class Main {
   public static void main(String[] args) {
      StringBuilder strBuild = new StringBuilder();
      Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
      int t = sc.nextInt();
      int length = 0;
      char tempChar ='a';
      BigInteger prd=BigInteger.ONE;
      while(t>0){
    	  int arr[] = new int[5];
    	  String str = sc.next();
    	  length = str.length();
    	  prd=BigInteger.ONE;
    	  for(int i=0;i<length;++i){
    		  tempChar = str.charAt(i);
    		  if(tempChar=='a'){
    			  arr[0]+=1;
    		  }else if(tempChar=='A'){
    			  arr[0]+=2;
    		  }
    		  if(tempChar=='e'){
    			  arr[1]+=1;
    		  }else if(tempChar=='E'){
    			  arr[1]+=2;
    		  }
    		  if(tempChar=='i'){
    			  arr[2]+=1;
    		  }else if(tempChar=='I'){
    			  arr[2]+=2;
    		  }
    		  if(tempChar=='o'){
    			  arr[3]+=1;
    		  }else if(tempChar=='O'){
    			  arr[3]+=2;
    		  }
    		  if(tempChar=='u'){
    			  arr[4]+=1;
    		  }else if(tempChar=='U'){
    			  arr[4]+=2;
    		  }
    	  }
    	  for(int i =0;i<5;++i){
    		  if(arr[i]!=0){
    			  prd=prd.multiply(BigInteger.valueOf(arr[i]));
    		  }
    	  }
    	  strBuild.append(prd.toString()+"\n");
    	  t--;
      }
      System.out.println(strBuild.toString());
   }
}
